p: The statistics on factors associated with root failure in Table 5 are presented in Table 6. The p-values indicating a significance for Cochraneâ€™s Q differ in case of root failure significantly for DBH 2H of coniferous trees, Stem mass and Tree mass. This suggests the presence of heterogeneity, meaning that the correlations between these factors and root failure among studies differ from each other for the different species. Table 5 shows that the non-significant values for all other factors appear in cases of a small number of effect sizes, in other words that there is not enough statistical power to detect a variability which can explain heterogeneity. The reported effect sizes for two factors come from deciduous trees: DBH deciduous and DBH 2H deciduous. The other factors originate from coniferous trees.
